metadata.title: CVE-2023-39193 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel. Thesctp_mt_check did not validate the flag_count field. This flaw allows alocal privileged (CAP_NET_ADMIN) attacker to trigger an out-of-bounds read,leading to a crash or information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-248-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-248-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-248-lowlatency - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1125-aws - 4.4.0-1125.131
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1172-azure - 4.15.0-1172.187~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.131').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1172.187~14.04.1').
